resources.string: PiPedal requires PRECISE location permissions in order to discover PiPedal devices on the local Wi-Fi connection, or via Wi-Fi Direct. APPROXIMATE location permissions are not sufficient.
PiPedal needs the following permission in order to discover and connect to PiPedal devices on the local Wi-Fi network.
PiPedal started as a Pandemic Project, a labor of love, and grew into something extraordinary. But I can no longer afford to continue development without your support.\n\n-- Robin E. R. Davies.

html.body:
To successfully connect to PiPedal, one of the following conditions must be true:


Your Android device and your Raspberry Pi must be connected to the same network via a Wi-Fi connection (or ethernet connection, if that applies).

 Your Android device and your Raspberry Pi must be connected to the same network via a PiPedal Auto-Hotpost

 


If you are connecting to a PiPedal Auto-Hotspot for the first time, you must connect to the Wi-Fi hotspot using the Android Wi-Fi network user interface. Click on Connect to Wi-Fi network and select the PiPedal Wi-Fi hotspot from there.

 The way the PiPedal auto-hotspot feature is intended to work is that:


When you are at home, your Android device and your Raspberry Pi will connect to each other using your home Wi-Fi router.


When you are playing away from home, your Raspberry Pi will not be able to find your home Wi-Fi router, so it will automatically start a Wi-Fi hotspot. Your Android device also won't be able to find your home Wi-Fi router, but will find the Wi-Fi hotspot on the Raspberry Pi, and will connect to it automatically, because it remembers it.

 Either way, your Android device connects to a Wi-Fi network that the Raspberry Pi is using, and the PiPedal client automatically discovers and connects to the Raspberry Pi.

 To get this to work, you will have to configure PiPedal to start up a hotspot network. The Auto-Hotspot connection is not configured by default. Consult PiPedal's online documentation for a discussion of how to configure Pipedal's Auto-Hotspot.

 You should configure the PiPedal Auto-Hotspot now, so that, when you do take PiPedal out on an adventure away from home, you will be able to connect. When you are away from home, you may not have the tools, and the Wi-Fi router you need to change PiPedals configuration on your Raspberry Pi. So, do it now, and test that it works before you try to use PiPedal outside of your home.

 If you have multiple PiPedal devices, you can switch connections from the PiPedal user-interface by selecting Connect to a different device from the PiPedal's Settings panel.

resources.string: Select a device to connect to

When connecting to a PiPedal auto-hotspot for the first time, you must connect using the Android Wi-Fi Network user interface in order to set a password for the Wi-Fi hotspot network. After that Android should auto-connect to the hotspot whenever it is visible.
